title: GPT-5.3-Codex Now Generally Available
description: GitHub Copilot rolled out GPT-5.3-Codex, offering approximately 25% performance improvement in agentic coding tasks compared to GPT-5.2-Codex. The model significantly reduces wait times for complex, long-running workflows and is optimized for architecture design and automated refactoring.

community_feedback.quote: Codex is excellent at discovering errors and small inconsistencies. Claude Code is good at 'raw programming', but Codex is unbeaten at carefully and systematically discovering 'problems'
They better take significant action, or OpenAI will kill Claude Code
Reddit's programming community 'directly exploded' with reactions noting concerns about AI-generated code feeding back into training
The model was viewed as a strong competitor to Claude in the code generation accuracy space
Copilot performed poorly in frontend styling and UI design compared to competitors like Cursor and Google AI Studio
AI-generated code was rapidly increasing in GitHub public repositories (4% of commits already AI-generated)

title: Major February 2026 Update - GPT-5.2-Codex Integration
description: OpenAI released a comprehensive update to Codex CLI, evolving from 'code completion' to an 'AI collaborator' with cloud-based intelligent agents, new CLI tools and macOS desktop application. Features include 40% faster inference speed, support for 400,000 token input, 50+ programming languages, MCP protocol integration, and 'working tree' mechanism for task distribution.

community_feedback.quote: One developer reportedly wrote a web crawler in 3 minutes using Codex
VC firm a16z partner reacted with concern to Codex's capabilities
Codex still lags Claude Code in user experience but the gap is narrowing
Concerns about added latency (up to 5 seconds) for free tier during peak times
macOS app achieved over 200,000 downloads on the first day
